sentence.text: Deficits in protein polyubiquitinationNA biogenesis have been linked to neurological deficits in humans, and widespread changes in miRNA levels occur in epilepsy, traumatic brain injury, and in response to less dramatic brain insults in rodent models.

Recently, microdeletions encompassing MIR137HG, the host gene which encodes the protein polyubiquitinationNA miR-137, have been linked to autism and intellectual disability, and genome wide association studies have linked this locus to schizophrenia.
